fields.headline: Transfer deadline dealings
fields.bodyText: Premiership clubs are gearing up for a week of frenzied transfer activity as they attempt to finalise their squads for the campaign before Thursday's midnight deadline. The fax machines in club boardrooms will continue to spit out bids today from proposed multi-million pound transfers to long-term loan deals. In the final week of last year's August window there were several significant moves: Michael Owen to Newcastle; Jermaine Jenas to Tottenham Hotspur; Fabio Rochemback to Middlesbrough. Manchester United appear likely to add significantly to their squad this week, with interest maintained in Owen Hargreaves at Bayern Munich and Juventus's David Trezeguet, with resolution of some kind also due in Ashley Cole's potential move across London from Arsenal to Chelsea. Arsenal Wanted Franck Ribéry (Marseille), William Gallas (Chelsea), Steven Naismith (Kilmarnock), Curtis Davies (West Bromwich Albion) Out José Antonio Reyes (Real Madrid, Atletico Madrid, Sevilla), Ashley Cole (Chelsea) Aston Villa Wanted Stilian Petrov (Celtic) Blackburn Rovers Wanted Kristofer Haested (IK Start), Danny Mills (Manchester City), Wael Gomaa (Al Ahii), Amr Zaki (Zamalek) Out Lucas Neill (Tottenham) Bolton Wanderers Wanted Kristofer Haested (IK Start) Charlton Athletic Wanted Wayne Routledge (Tottenham), Julian Gray (Birmingham), Marvin Elliott (Millwall), Omar Pouso (Penarol),
